item.title: Deep Learning for Air Quality Prediction: From Data Cleaning to LSTMs.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Part 1. The Importance of Data Cleaning in Environmental Analysis

Data is often called the backbone of ML, but in the real world, data is rarely clean or ready for use. This is especially true for environmental data, where missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies are common. When predicting PM10 pollution levels in Auckland (NZ), the first challenge wasn’t building a model but cleaning the data. Imagine trying to build a house with warped bricks and missing mortar. Without proper cleaning, even the best models would struggle to produce meaningful results. In this part, I’ll explore the messy reality of working with air quality data and the critical role data cleaning played in this project.

item.title: AI-Powered Pneumonia Detection: Challenges, Model Comparisons, and Future Directions
item.description:
View Project on GitHub

Part 1. Challenges in Medical Imaging Datasets

Medical imaging datasets provide critical opportunities for deep learning (DL) applications, but they also come with unique challenges. In this project, aimed at detecting pneumonia using chest X-rays, we faced hurdles like dataset imbalance and small validation sets, which can hinder model performance. This blog discusses the key challenges and demonstrates pre-processing techniques—such as dataset re-sampling, data augmentation, and re-splitting—that helped us overcome these obstacles.
